topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55271d3963687245833c0000#post_55271d3963687245833c0000
And you want to know what happened?

*They fucking spread a Rumor that he was a Predator*

And He got so many hate comments and mail he had a nervous breakdown and left.

So now whenever Tumblr has a Bad update guess who's going to be there to fix it? *No one*.

Because they ran him away! 

*Claps*

Congratulations Tumblr! You fucked up! 

Totally unbelievable.
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55271cec636872065e810000#post_55271cec636872065e810000
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55271c0b63687210e2130000#post_55271c0b63687210e2130000
you still take stuff for it right? 

From what I hear it isn't something that just goes away. [/bq]
Symptoms lasted for a month and then all traces vanished

I still don't know what the heck happened exactly, but I'm fairly certain it was arthritis

I have had back pains ever since then, but it might be unrelated, as my pains were mostly in my arms and legs

Anyways no, I don't take any medication for my "arthritis," it was gone before the doctors could even identify what exactly it was

I had like 8 blood tests done on me in the course of a month, all results pretty much inconclusive

"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55271d3f63687274c5c40a00#post_55271d3f63687274c5c40a00
[bq="Carcass Strife"]Whelp, Black Ops 3 confirmed.[/bq]
...Huzzah?

I mean, I'm as sick of CoD making new games every year as the next guy, but I really liked the Black Ops series
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55271e956368722058ea0000#post_55271e956368722058ea0000
Hmmm, Now that's pretty strange?

Maybe you got to the doctors just in time.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55271ed063687208d4770600#post_55271ed063687208d4770600
I honestly have no clue

All I remember is that one day I suddenly could barely walk due to joint pains, and next thing I knew I could only slowly crawl everywhere

On my birthday it took like 5 minutes to climb downstairs to open my presents

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552720796368720b25580000#post_552720796368720b25580000
The newest movies aren't bad; they're like if you removed all the filler from the show rather than fit the entire story over the course of a entire season or only in two hours.

Essentially it's like a 6 hour movie rather than a 2 hour movie or a tv show.

I liked the scarcrow part in the new movies, because no matter how much those two tried to be free they could not nor would ever be free when all they wanted was to be a free person forever to be caged for the rest of their lives.

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/552721946368720b258c0000#post_552721946368720b258c0000
It wasn't as good, but it was still pretty good.


Scarcrow arch of the movies:
[spoiler]A hacker who escaped being forever trapped as a government worker did so by dubbing his ghost to escape overwritting other people's ghosts.  He then dubs his ghost into a governmental hacker and because they both wanted to be free so much they develop a dual ghost.  The problem is that they physically could not share the same ghost and the hacker trying to escape apologizes over and over for dubbing his ghost over the girl; she keeps saying it's okay over and over because they both wanted to be free because neither of them could ever in their lifetime live as they way.  They keep trying to escape over and over by taking over new bodies over and over no matter what it meant, even if they had to give up their memories or anything, until they both couldn't run anywhere else and chose to die rather than to live in forever having their freedom taken away because rather than being treated like people they were treated like property of the government.[/spoiler]

topics.body:
Sometimes I wonder why some buildings are so big.
And why there are so many people working there.

Is there a division that makes coffee and another that makes tea for the boss? Is there one guy that works only to sign stuff that has been approved? What is the purpose of thousands of office workers?!

Not that I hate them or anything. Just wondering.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5527268b63687245c66b0c00#post_5527268b63687245c66b0c00

One floor or even just a couple offices are destined for use. They're rented or bought for a specific purposes (A legal department, technical experts, etc.) The rest are destined to ventilation, electricity and overall maintenance
